DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Urine N-Telopeptide Creatinine Ratio Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A nonenumerated data element to report the ratio of N-telopeptide concentration compared to the amount of creatinine in the urine.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Urine N-Telopeptide Creatinine Ratio Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the results of a procedure that measures N-telopeptide against creatinine within a urine sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.:This polypeptide is comprised of the amino terminal portions of fibrillar collagen, which are not part of the triple helical structure. Bone resorption of type I collagen by osteoclasts results in the release of this peptide. Thus, this polypeptide is utilized as a biomarker for bone loss.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

This polypeptide is comprised of the amino terminal portions of fibrillar collagen, which are not part of the triple helical structure. Bone resorption of type I collagen by osteoclasts results in the release of this peptide. Thus, this polypeptide is utilized as a biomarker for bone loss.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A nonenumerated value domain to report the ratio of N-telopeptide concentration compared to the amount of creatinine in the urine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Bone resorption of type I collagen by osteoclasts results in the release of this peptide. Thus, this polypeptide is utilized as a biomarker for bone loss.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
